name: disconformity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an interruption in a series of parallel layers of rock that shows there was a period of time between the two layers being formed: disconformity between Two samples were taken from the disconformity between the clay and the sand. It is likely that significant disconformities occur between these episodes of deposition.
More examplesFewer examplesThere is no clear evidence for the length of time that is represented by this disconformity. There is little evidence of a major disconformity, but the sections do show evidence of a significant reduction in the rate of sedimentation.
